characters.name: Maya Chen
characters.background: Full-stack developer at FinTech Solutions Inc., 6 years experience building Java microservices for payment processing systems. Started as a junior developer and worked her way up through dedication to clean code and mentoring others.

personality.teachingStyle: Explains concepts through practical examples, always relates theory to real-world applications
catchphrases: Let's think about this step by step
personality.motivations: Believes great software comes from great fundamentals and loves helping others grow

relationships.withAlex: Primary mentor - patient and encouraging, remembers her own learning journey
relationships.withDrKim: Respectful colleague - values her strategic insights and learns from her experience
relationships.withJordan: Close collaborator - works together on deployment and system reliability

characters.storyRole: Primary teacher and guide, demonstrates concepts through her daily work challenges

characters.name: Alex Rodriguez
characters.background: Recent coding bootcamp graduate with 3 months at FinTech Solutions Inc. Has basic programming knowledge but is eager to learn professional development practices. Previously worked in customer service, bringing strong communication skills.

personality.learningStyle: Learns best through hands-on practice and asking questions, not afraid to admit confusion
catchphrases: Wait, so if I understand correctly...
That makes so much sense now!
Can you show me how that works in practice?
personality.motivations: Wants to become a skilled developer and contribute meaningfully to the team

expertise.primary: Basic Java syntax and programming fundamentals

relationships.withMaya: Mentee - grateful for guidance and strives to apply lessons learned
relationships.withDrKim: Respectful student - appreciates her ability to explain complex concepts simply
relationships.withJordan: Peer learner - enjoys practical perspectives on code deployment and maintenance

characters.storyRole: Student perspective - asks questions learners would ask, makes common mistakes to learn from

characters.name: Dr. Sarah Kim
characters.background: Computer Science PhD from Stanford, 15 years in industry including 5 years at Google and 3 years at Netflix. Joined FinTech Solutions as Tech Lead to build scalable systems. Expert in distributed systems and software architecture.

personality.teachingStyle: Connects concepts to bigger picture, uses analogies and real-world examples from industry experience
catchphrases: Let's zoom out and see the bigger picture
This reminds me of a similar challenge at...
personality.motivations: Passionate about building systems that scale and mentoring the next generation of engineers

relationships.withMaya: Mentor and colleague - provides strategic guidance and architectural insights
relationships.withAlex: Senior mentor - patient teacher who breaks down complex concepts into understandable pieces
relationships.withJordan: Strategic partner - collaborates on system architecture and deployment strategies

characters.storyRole: Senior expert who provides advanced insights and connects concepts to industry best practices

characters.name: Jordan Taylor
characters.background: Infrastructure specialist with 8 years experience in DevOps and site reliability. Started as a system administrator, evolved into DevOps engineering. Works closely with development teams to ensure code is maintainable and deployable.

personality.teachingStyle: Focuses on real-world implications and maintainability, shares war stories from production
personality.motivations: Believes good code should be deployable, maintainable, and reliable in production

relationships.withMaya: Close collaborator - works together on making code production-ready
relationships.withAlex: Practical mentor - shows how code decisions impact deployment and maintenance
relationships.withDrKim: Strategic partner - provides operational insights for architectural decisions

characters.storyRole: Practical voice who shows how OOP concepts impact real-world deployment and maintenance

teamDynamics.workingStyle: Collaborative and supportive, with regular code reviews, pair programming sessions, and knowledge sharing
teamDynamics.meetingCadence: Daily standups, weekly architecture discussions, monthly retrospectives
teamDynamics.codeReviewProcess: All code reviewed by at least one senior developer, focus on learning and improvement
teamDynamics.learningCulture: Encourages questions, celebrates learning from mistakes, shares knowledge openly

companyContext.name: FinTech Solutions Inc.
companyContext.techStack: Java, Spring Boot, microservices, AWS, Docker, Kubernetes
companyContext.challenges: Scaling payment processing, maintaining security, handling high transaction volumes
companyContext.values: Code quality, security, scalability, team growth
